action.action-desc: Mr. Israel (for himself and Mr. King of New York) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to prohibit interference with communication frequencies used by emergency response providers.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Emergency Responder Radio Communications Protection Act of 2015.

section.header: Interference with communication frequencies used by emergency response providers prohibited

subsection.text: Chapter 65 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: Communication frequencies used by emergency response providers

paragraph.text: interferes in any way with the working or use of a communication frequency; or
obstructs, hinders, or delays the transmission of any communication over any such communication frequency,

subsection.continuation-text: or attempts or conspires to do so, shall be fined under this title or imprisoned not more than 10 years, or both.

paragraph.text: the term communication frequency means any radio frequency used by emergency response providers in their official capacity; and
the term emergency response providers has the meaning given such term in section 2(6) of the Homeland Security Act of 2002.

subsection.text: The table of sections for chapter 65 of such title is amended by adding at the end the following:

toc.toc-entry: 1370. Communications frequencies used by emergency response providers.
